Enum.Name: ARC_SIZE
Enum.Comment: Differentiates which of the two possible arcs could match the given arc parameters.

Enum.Name: GEOMETRY_SIMPLIFICATION_OPTION
Enum.Comment: Specifies how simple the output of a simplified geometry sink should be.

Field.Name: NEAREST_NEIGHBOR
Field.Comment: Nearest Neighbor filtering. Also known as nearest pixel or nearest point sampling.

Field.Name: LINEAR
Field.Comment: Linear filtering.

Enum.Name: GAMMA
Enum.Comment: This determines what gamma is used for interpolation/blending.

Field.Comment: Colors are manipulated in 2.2 gamma color space.
Colors are manipulated in 1.0 gamma color space.

Enum.Name: OPACITY_MASK_CONTENT
Enum.Comment: Specifies what the contents are of an opacity mask.

Field.Name: GRAPHICS
Field.Comment: The mask contains geometries or bitmaps.

Field.Name: TEXT_NATURAL
Field.Comment: The mask contains text rendered using one of the natural text modes.

Field.Name: TEXT_GDI_COMPATIBLE
Field.Comment: The mask contains text rendered using one of the GDI compatible text modes.

Enum.Name: COMBINE_MODE
Enum.Comment: This enumeration describes the type of combine operation to be performed.

Field.Name: UNION
Field.Comment: Produce a geometry representing the set of points contained in either the first or the second geometry.

Field.Name: INTERSECT
Field.Comment: Produce a geometry representing the set of points common to the first and the second geometries.

Field.Name: XOR
Field.Comment: Produce a geometry representing the set of points contained in the first geometry or the second geometry, but not both.

Field.Name: EXCLUDE
Field.Comment: Produce a geometry representing the set of points contained in the first geometry but not the second geometry.

Enum.Name: DEBUG_LEVEL
Enum.Comment: Indicates the debug level to be output by the debug layer.

Enum.Name: DRAW_TEXT_OPTIONS
Enum.Comment: Modifications made to the draw text call that influence how the text is rendered.

Field.Name: NO_SNAP
Field.Comment: Do not snap the baseline of the text vertically.

Field.Name: CLIP
Field.Comment: Clip the text to the content bounds.

Field.Name: ENABLE_COLOR_FONT
Field.Comment: Render color versions of glyphs if defined by the font.

Enum.Name: ANTIALIAS_MODE
Enum.Comment: Enum which describes the manner in which we render edges of non-text primitives.

Field.Name: PER_PRIMITIVE
Field.Comment: The edges of each primitive are antialiased sequentially.

Field.Name: ALIASED
Field.Comment: Each pixel is rendered if its pixel center is contained by the geometry.

Enum.Name: ALPHA_MODE
Enum.Comment: Qualifies how alpha is to be treated in a bitmap or render target containing alpha.

Field.Name: UNKNOWN
Field.Comment: Alpha mode should be determined implicitly. Some target surfaces do not supply or imply this information in which case alpha must be specified.

Field.Name: PREMULTIPLIED
Field.Comment: Treat the alpha as premultipled.

Field.Name: STRAIGHT
Field.Comment: Opacity is in the 'A' component only.

Field.Name: IGNORE
Field.Comment: Ignore any alpha channel information.

Enum.Name: EXTEND_MODE
Enum.Comment: Enum which describes how to sample from a source outside its base tile.

Field.Name: CLAMP
Field.Comment: Extend the edges of the source out by clamping sample points outside the source to the edges.

Field.Name: WRAP
Field.Comment: The base tile is drawn untransformed and the remainder are filled by repeating the base tile.

Field.Name: MIRROR
Field.Comment: The same as wrap, but alternate tiles are flipped The base tile is drawn untransformed.

Enum.Name: FACTORY_TYPE
Enum.Comment: Specifies the threading model of the created factory and all of its derived resources.

Field.Name: SINGLE_THREADED
Field.Comment: The resulting factory and derived resources may only be invoked serially. Reference counts on resources are interlocked, however, resource and render target state is not protected from multi-threaded access.

Field.Name: MULTI_THREADED
Field.Comment: The resulting factory may be invoked from multiple threads. Returned resources use interlocked reference counting and their state is protected.

Field.Name: DEFAULT
Field.Comment: The caller does not require a particular underlying D3D device level.
The D3D device level is DX9 compatible.
The D3D device level is DX10 compatible.

Enum.Name: FIGURE_BEGIN
Enum.Comment: Indicates whether the given figure is filled or hollow.

Enum.Name: FIGURE_END
Enum.Comment: Indicates whether the figure is open or closed on its end point.

Field.Name: UNKNOWN
Field.Comment: The relation between the geometries couldn't be determined. This value is never returned by any D2D method.

Field.Name: DISJOINT
Field.Comment: The two geometries do not intersect at all.

Field.Name: IS_CONTAINED
Field.Comment: The passed in geometry is entirely contained by the object.

Field.Name: CONTAINS
Field.Comment: The object entirely contains the passed in geometry.

Field.Name: OVERLAP
Field.Comment: The two geometries overlap but neither completely contains the other.

Enum.Name: PATH_SEGMENT
Enum.Comment: Indicates whether the given segment should be stroked, or, if the join between this segment and the previous one should be smooth.

Enum.Name: CAP_STYLE
Enum.Comment: Enum which describes the drawing of the ends of a line.

Field.Name: FLAT
Field.Comment: Flat line cap.

Field.Name: SQUARE
Field.Comment: Square line cap.

Field.Name: ROUND
Field.Comment: Round line cap.

Field.Name: TRIANGLE
Field.Comment: Triangle line cap.

Enum.Name: LAYER_OPTIONS
Enum.Comment: Specified options that can be applied when a layer resource is applied to create a layer.

Field.Name: INITIALIZE_FOR_CLEARTYPE
Field.Comment: The layer will render correctly for ClearType text. If the render target was set to ClearType previously, the layer will continue to render ClearType. If the render target was set to ClearType and this option is not specified, the render target will be set to render gray-scale until the layer is popped. The caller can override this default by calling SetTextAntialiasMode while within the layer. This flag is slightly slower than the default.

Enum.Name: LINE_JOIN
Enum.Comment: Enum which describes the drawing of the corners on the line.

Field.Name: MITER
Field.Comment: Miter join.

Field.Name: BEVEL
Field.Comment: Bevel join.

Field.Name: ROUND
Field.Comment: Round join.

Field.Name: MITER_OR_BEVEL
Field.Comment: Miter/Bevel join.

Field.Name: RETAIN_CONTENTS
Field.Comment: Keep the target contents intact through present.

Field.Name: IMMEDIATELY
Field.Comment: Do not wait for display refresh to commit changes to display.

Field.Name: FORCE_BITMAP_REMOTING
Field.Comment: Rendering will occur locally, if a terminal-services session is established, the bitmap updates will be sent to the terminal services client.

Field.Name: GDI_COMPATIBLE
Field.Comment: The render target will allow a call to GetDC on the ID2D1GdiInteropRenderTarget interface. Rendering will also occur locally.

Field.Name: DEFAULT
Field.Comment: D2D is free to choose the render target type for the caller.

Field.Name: SOFTWARE
Field.Comment: The render target will render using the CPU.

Field.Name: HARDWARE
Field.Comment: The render target will render using the GPU.

Field.Name: GDI_COMPATIBLE
Field.Comment: The compatible render target will allow a call to GetDC on the ID2D1GdiInteropRenderTarget interface. This can be specified even if the parent render target is not GDI compatible.

Field.Name: DEFAULT
Field.Comment: Render text using the current system setting.

Field.Name: CLEARTYPE
Field.Comment: Render text using ClearType.

Field.Name: GRAYSCALE
Field.Comment: Render text using gray-scale.

Field.Name: ALIASED
Field.Comment: Render text aliased.

Field.Name: COPY
Field.Comment: The contents of the D2D render target will be copied to the DC.

Field.Name: CLEAR
Field.Comment: The contents of the DC will be cleared.

Struct.Name: ARC_SEGMENT
Struct.Comment: Describes an arc that is defined as part of a path.

Struct.Name: BEZIER_SEGMENT
Struct.Comment: Describes a cubic bezier in a path.

Struct.Name: DRAWING_STATE_DESCRIPTION
Struct.Comment: Allows the drawing state to be atomically created. This also specifies the drawing state that is saved into an IDrawingStateBlock object.

Struct.Name: FACTORY_OPTIONS
Struct.Comment: Allows additional parameters for factory creation.

Field.Name: debugLevel
Field.Comment: Requests a certain level of debugging information from the debug layer. This parameter is ignored if the debug layer DLL is not present.

Field.Name: contentBounds
Field.Comment: The rectangular clip that will be applied to the layer. The clip is affected by the world transform. Content outside of the content bounds will not render.

Field.Name: geometricMask
Field.Comment: A general mask that can be optionally applied to the content. Content not inside the fill of the mask will not be rendered.

Field.Name: maskAntialiasMode
Field.Comment: Specifies whether the mask should be aliased or antialiased.

Field.Name: maskTransform
Field.Comment: An additional transform that may be applied to the mask in addition to the current world transform.

Field.Name: opacity
Field.Comment: The opacity with which all of the content in the layer will be blended back to the target when the layer is popped.

Field.Name: opacityBrush
Field.Comment: An additional brush that can be applied to the layer. Only the opacity channel is sampled from this brush and multiplied both with the layer content and the over-all layer opacity.

Field.Name: layerOptions
Field.Comment: Specifies if ClearType will be rendered into the layer.

Struct.Name: STROKE_STYLE_PROPERTIES
Struct.Comment: Properties, aside from the width, that allow geometric penning to be specified.

Interface.Name: IResource
Interface.Comment: The root interface for all resources in D2D.

Method.Name: GetFactory
Method.Comment: Retrieve the factory associated with this resource.

Interface.Name: IBitmap
Interface.Comment: Root bitmap resource, linearly scaled on a draw call.

Method.Name: GetSize
Method.Comment: Returns the size of the bitmap in resolution independent units.

Method.Name: GetPixelSize
Method.Comment: Returns the size of the bitmap in resolution dependent units, (pixels).

Method.Name: GetPixelFormat
Method.Comment: Retrieve the format of the bitmap.

Method.Name: GetDpi
Method.Comment: Return the DPI of the bitmap.

Interface.Name: IGradientStopCollection
Interface.Comment: Represents an collection of gradient stops that can then be the source resource for either a linear or radial gradient brush.

Method.Name: GetGradientStopCount
Method.Comment: Returns the number of stops in the gradient.

Method.Name: GetGradientStops
Method.Comment: Copies the gradient stops from the collection into the caller's interface. The returned colors have straight alpha.

Method.Name: GetColorInterpolationGamma
Method.Comment: Returns whether the interpolation occurs with 1.0 or 2.2 gamma.

Interface.Name: IBrush
Interface.Comment: The root brush interface. All brushes can be used to fill or pen a geometry.

Method.Name: SetOpacity
Method.Comment: Sets the opacity for when the brush is drawn over the entire fill of the brush.

Method.Name: SetTransform
Method.Comment: Sets the transform that applies to everything drawn by the brush.

Interface.Name: IBitmapBrush
Interface.Comment: A bitmap brush allows a bitmap to be used to fill a geometry.

Method.Name: SetExtendModeX
Method.Comment: Sets how the bitmap is to be treated outside of its natural extent on the X axis.

Method.Name: SetExtendModeY
Method.Comment: Sets how the bitmap is to be treated outside of its natural extent on the X axis.

Method.Name: SetInterpolationMode
Method.Comment: Sets the interpolation mode used when this brush is used.

Method.Name: SetBitmap
Method.Comment: Sets the bitmap associated as the source of this brush.

Method.Name: SetEndPoint
Method.Comment: Sets the end point of the gradient in local coordinate space. This is not influenced by the geometry being filled.

Method.Name: SetCenter
Method.Comment: Sets the center of the radial gradient. This will be in local coordinates and will not depend on the geometry being filled.

Method.Name: SetGradientOriginOffset
Method.Comment: Sets offset of the origin relative to the radial gradient center.

Method.Name: GetDescription
Method.Comment: Retrieves the state currently contained within this state block resource.

Method.Name: SetDescription
Method.Comment: Sets the state description of this state block resource.

Method.Name: SetTextRenderingParams
Method.Comment: Sets the text rendering parameters of this state block resource.

Method.Name: GetTextRenderingParams
Method.Comment: Retrieves the text rendering parameters contained within this state block resource. If a NULL text rendering parameter was specified, NULL will be returned.

Method.Name: CreateBitmap
Method.Comment: Create a D2D bitmap by copying from memory, or create uninitialized.

Method.Name: CreateBitmapFromWicBitmap
Method.Comment: Create a D2D bitmap by copying a WIC bitmap.

Method.Name: CreateBitmapFromWicBitmap
Method.Comment: Create a D2D bitmap by copying a WIC bitmap.

Method.Name: CreateBitmapFromWicBitmap
Method.Comment: Create a D2D bitmap by copying a WIC bitmap.

Method.Name: CreateSharedBitmap
Method.Comment: Create a D2D bitmap by sharing bits from another resource. The bitmap must be compatible with the render target for the call to succeed. For example, an IWICBitmap can be shared with a software target, or a DXGI surface can be shared with a DXGI render target.

Method.Name: CreateBitmapBrush
Method.Comment: Creates a bitmap brush. The bitmap is scaled, rotated, skewed or tiled to fill or pen a geometry.

Method.Name: CreateBitmapBrush
Method.Comment: Creates a bitmap brush. The bitmap is scaled, rotated, skewed or tiled to fill or pen a geometry.

Method.Name: CreateBitmapBrush
Method.Comment: Creates a bitmap brush. The bitmap is scaled, rotated, skewed or tiled to fill or pen a geometry.

Method.Name: CreateBitmapBrush
Method.Comment: Creates a bitmap brush. The bitmap is scaled, rotated, skewed or tiled to fill or pen a geometry.

Method.Name: CreateGradientStopCollection
Method.Comment: A gradient stop collection represents a set of stops in an ideal unit length. This is the source resource for a linear gradient and radial gradient brush.

Parameter.Name: colorInterpolationGamma
Parameter.Comment: Specifies which space the color interpolation occurs in.

Parameter.Name: extendMode
Parameter.Comment: Specifies how the gradient will be extended outside of the unit length.

Method.Name: CreateCompatibleRenderTarget
Method.Comment: Creates a bitmap render target whose bitmap can be used as a source for rendering in the API.

Parameter.Name: desiredSize
Parameter.Comment: The requested size of the target in DIPs. If the pixel size is not specified, the DPI is inherited from the parent target. However, the render target will never contain a fractional number of pixels.

Parameter.Name: desiredPixelSize
Parameter.Comment: The requested size of the render target in pixels. If the DIP size is also specified, the DPI is calculated from these two values. If the desired size is not specified, the DPI is inherited from the parent render target. If neither value is specified, the compatible render target will be the same size and have the same DPI as the parent target.

Parameter.Name: desiredFormat
Parameter.Comment: The desired pixel format. The format must be compatible with the parent render target type. If the format is not specified, it will be inherited from the parent render target.

Parameter.Name: options
Parameter.Comment: Allows the caller to retrieve a GDI compatible render target.

Method.Name: CreateLayer
Method.Comment: Creates a layer resource that can be used on any target and which will resize under the covers if necessary.

Parameter.Name: size
Parameter.Comment: The resolution independent minimum size hint for the layer resource. Specify this to prevent unwanted reallocation of the layer backing store. The size is in DIPs, but, it is unaffected by the current world transform. If the size is unspecified, the returned resource is a placeholder and the backing store will be allocated to be the minimum size that can hold the content when the layer is pushed.

Method.Name: CreateMesh
Method.Comment: Create a D2D mesh.

Parameter.Name: opacityBrush
Parameter.Comment: An optionally specified opacity brush. Only the alpha channel of the corresponding brush will be sampled and will be applied to the entire fill of the geometry. If this brush is specified, the fill brush must be a bitmap brush with an extend mode of D2D1_EXTEND_MODE_CLAMP.

Method.Name: FillMesh
Method.Comment: Fill a mesh. Since meshes can only render aliased content, the render target antialiasing mode must be set to aliased.

Method.Name: FillOpacityMask
Method.Comment: Fill using the alpha channel of the supplied opacity mask bitmap. The brush opacity will be modulated by the mask. The render target antialiasing mode must be set to aliased.

Method.Name: DrawText
Method.Comment: Draws the text within the given layout rectangle and by default also snaps and clips it to the content bounds.

Method.Name: DrawText
Method.Comment: Draws the text within the given layout rectangle and by default also snaps and clips it.

Method.Name: DrawTextLayout
Method.Comment: Draw a snapped text layout object. Since the layout is not subsequently changed, this can be more efficient than DrawText when drawing the same layout repeatedly.

Parameter.Name: options
Parameter.Comment: The specified text options. NOTE: By default the text is clipped to the layout bounds. This is derived from the origin and the layout bounds of the corresponding IDWriteTextLayout object.

Method.Name: GetTextRenderingParams
Method.Comment: Retrieve the text render parameters. NOTE: If NULL is specified to SetTextRenderingParameters, NULL will be returned.

Method.Name: SetTags
Method.Comment: Set a tag to correspond to the succeeding primitives. If an error occurs rendering a primitive, the tags can be returned from the Flush or EndDraw call.

Method.Name: GetTags
Method.Comment: Retrieves the currently set tags. This does not retrieve the tags corresponding to any primitive that is in error.

Method.Name: PushLayer
Method.Comment: Start a layer of drawing calls. The way in which the layer must be resolved is specified first as well as the logical resource that stores the layer parameters. The supplied layer resource might grow if the specified content cannot fit inside it. The layer will grow monotonically on each axis. If a NULL ID2D1Layer is provided, then a layer resource will be allocated automatically.

Method.Name: PopLayer
Method.Comment: Ends a layer that was defined with particular layer resources.

Method.Name: SaveDrawingState
Method.Comment: Gets the current drawing state and saves it into the supplied IDrawingStatckBlock.

Method.Name: RestoreDrawingState
Method.Comment: Copies the state stored in the block interface.

Method.Name: PushAxisAlignedClip
Method.Comment: Pushes a clip. The clip can be antialiased. The clip must be axis aligned. If the current world transform is not axis preserving, then the bounding box of the transformed clip rect will be used. The clip will remain in effect until a PopAxisAligned clip call is made.

Method.Name: BeginDraw
Method.Comment: Start drawing on this render target. Draw calls can only be issued between a BeginDraw and EndDraw call.

Method.Name: EndDraw
Method.Comment: Ends drawing on the render target, error results can be retrieved at this time, or when calling flush.

Method.Name: SetDpi
Method.Comment: Sets the DPI on the render target. This results in the render target being interpreted to a different scale. Neither DPI can be negative. If zero is specified for both, the system DPI is chosen. If one is zero and the other unspecified, the DPI is not changed.

Method.Name: GetDpi
Method.Comment: Return the current DPI from the target.

Method.Name: GetSize
Method.Comment: Returns the size of the render target in DIPs.

Method.Name: GetPixelSize
Method.Comment: Returns the size of the render target in pixels.

Method.Name: GetMaximumBitmapSize
Method.Comment: Returns the maximum bitmap and render target size that is guaranteed to be supported by the render target.

Method.Name: IsSupported
Method.Comment: Returns true if the given properties are supported by this render target. The DPI is ignored. NOTE: If the render target type is software, then neither D2D1_FEATURE_LEVEL_9 nor D2D1_FEATURE_LEVEL_10 will be considered to be supported.

Method.Name: Resize
Method.Comment: Resize the buffer underlying the render target. This operation might fail if there is insufficient video memory or system memory, or if the render target is resized beyond the maximum bitmap size. If the method fails, the render target will be placed in a zombie state and D2DERR_RECREATE_TARGET will be returned from it when EndDraw is called. In addition an appropriate failure result will be returned from Resize.

Interface.Name: IStrokeStyle
Interface.Comment: Resource interface that holds pen style properties.

Method.Name: GetDashes
Method.Comment: Returns the dashes from the object into a user allocated array. The user must call GetDashesCount to retrieve the required size.

Method.Name: GetBounds
Method.Comment: Retrieve the bounds of the geometry, with an optional applied transform.

Method.Name: GetBounds
Method.Comment: Retrieve the bounds of the geometry, with an optional applied transform.

Method.Name: GetWidenedBounds
Method.Comment: Get the bounds of the corresponding geometry after it has been widened or have an optional pen style applied.

Method.Name: GetWidenedBounds
Method.Comment: Get the bounds of the corresponding geometry after it has been widened or have an optional pen style applied.

Method.Name: GetWidenedBounds
Method.Comment: Get the bounds of the corresponding geometry after it has been widened or have an optional pen style applied.

Method.Name: GetWidenedBounds
Method.Comment: Get the bounds of the corresponding geometry after it has been widened or have an optional pen style applied.

Method.Name: StrokeContainsPoint
Method.Comment: Checks to see whether the corresponding penned and widened geometry contains the given point.

Method.Name: StrokeContainsPoint
Method.Comment: Checks to see whether the corresponding penned and widened geometry contains the given point.

Method.Name: FillContainsPoint
Method.Comment: Test whether the given fill of this geometry would contain this point.

Method.Name: FillContainsPoint
Method.Comment: Test whether the given fill of this geometry would contain this point.

Method.Name: CompareWithGeometry
Method.Comment: Compare how one geometry intersects or contains another geometry.

Method.Name: CompareWithGeometry
Method.Comment: Compare how one geometry intersects or contains another geometry.

Method.Name: CompareWithGeometry
Method.Comment: Compare how one geometry intersects or contains another geometry.

Method.Name: CompareWithGeometry
Method.Comment: Compare how one geometry intersects or contains another geometry.

Method.Name: Simplify
Method.Comment: Converts a geometry to a simplified geometry that has arcs and quadratic beziers removed.

Method.Name: Simplify
Method.Comment: Converts a geometry to a simplified geometry that has arcs and quadratic beziers removed.

Method.Name: Simplify
Method.Comment: Converts a geometry to a simplified geometry that has arcs and quadratic beziers removed.

Method.Name: Simplify
Method.Comment: Converts a geometry to a simplified geometry that has arcs and quadratic beziers removed.

Method.Name: Tessellate
Method.Comment: Tessellates a geometry into triangles.

Method.Name: Tessellate
Method.Comment: Tessellates a geometry into triangles.

Method.Name: Tessellate
Method.Comment: Tessellates a geometry into triangles.

Method.Name: Tessellate
Method.Comment: Tessellates a geometry into triangles.

Method.Name: CombineWithGeometry
Method.Comment: Performs a combine operation between the two geometries to produce a resulting geometry.

Method.Name: CombineWithGeometry
Method.Comment: Performs a combine operation between the two geometries to produce a resulting geometry.

Method.Name: CombineWithGeometry
Method.Comment: Performs a combine operation between the two geometries to produce a resulting geometry.

Method.Name: CombineWithGeometry
Method.Comment: Performs a combine operation between the two geometries to produce a resulting geometry.

Method.Name: Outline
Method.Comment: Computes the outline of the geometry. The result is written back into a simplified geometry sink.

Method.Name: Outline
Method.Comment: Computes the outline of the geometry. The result is written back into a simplified geometry sink.

Method.Name: Outline
Method.Comment: Computes the outline of the geometry. The result is written back into a simplified geometry sink.

Method.Name: Outline
Method.Comment: Computes the outline of the geometry. The result is written back into a simplified geometry sink.

Method.Name: ComputeArea
Method.Comment: Computes the area of the geometry.

Method.Name: ComputeArea
Method.Comment: Computes the area of the geometry.

Method.Name: ComputeArea
Method.Comment: Computes the area of the geometry.

Method.Name: ComputeArea
Method.Comment: Computes the area of the geometry.

Method.Name: ComputeLength
Method.Comment: Computes the length of the geometry.

Method.Name: ComputeLength
Method.Comment: Computes the length of the geometry.

Method.Name: ComputeLength
Method.Comment: Computes the length of the geometry.

Method.Name: ComputeLength
Method.Comment: Computes the length of the geometry.

Method.Name: ComputePointAtLength
Method.Comment: Computes the point and tangent a given distance along the path.

Method.Name: ComputePointAtLength
Method.Comment: Computes the point and tangent a given distance along the path.

Method.Name: ComputePointAtLength
Method.Comment: Computes the point and tangent a given distance along the path.

Method.Name: ComputePointAtLength
Method.Comment: Computes the point and tangent a given distance along the path.

Method.Name: Widen
Method.Comment: Get the geometry and widen it as well as apply an optional pen style.

Method.Name: Widen
Method.Comment: Get the geometry and widen it as well as apply an optional pen style.

Method.Name: Widen
Method.Comment: Get the geometry and widen it as well as apply an optional pen style.

Method.Name: Widen
Method.Comment: Get the geometry and widen it as well as apply an optional pen style.

Method.Name: Open
Method.Comment: Opens a geometry sink that will be used to create this path geometry.

Method.Name: Stream
Method.Comment: Retrieve the contents of this geometry. The caller passes an implementation of a ID2D1GeometrySink interface to receive the data.

Method.Name: Open
Method.Comment: Opens the mesh for population.

Interface.Name: IFactory
Interface.Comment: The root factory interface for all of D2D's objects.

Method.Name: ReloadSystemMetrics
Method.Comment: Cause the factory to refresh any system metrics that it might have been snapped on factory creation.

Method.Name: GetDesktopDpi
Method.Comment: Retrieves the current desktop DPI. To refresh this, call ReloadSystemMetrics.

Method.Name: CreateGeometryGroup
Method.Comment: Create a geometry which holds other geometries.

Method.Name: CreatePathGeometry
Method.Comment: Returns an initially empty path geometry interface. A geometry sink is created off the interface to populate it.

Method.Name: CreateStrokeStyle
Method.Comment: Allows a non-default stroke style to be specified for a given geometry at draw time.

Method.Name: CreateDrawingStateBlock
Method.Comment: Creates a new drawing state block, this can be used in subsequent SaveDrawingState and RestoreDrawingState operations on the render target.

Method.Name: CreateWicBitmapRenderTarget
Method.Comment: Creates a render target which is a source of bitmaps.

Method.Name: CreateHwndRenderTarget
Method.Comment: Creates a render target that appears on the display.

Method.Name: CreateDxgiSurfaceRenderTarget
Method.Comment: Creates a render target that draws to a DXGI Surface. The device that owns the surface is used for rendering.

Method.Name: CreateDCRenderTarget
Method.Comment: Creates a render target that draws to a GDI device context.
